content: ðŸš€ AI in 2025: It's Not Just About Language, It's About ActionI recently came across an insightful take by Srikanth Velamakanni, co-founder of Fractal, in his interview with LinkedIn News India. He challenges the current narrative around Indian AI models â€” especially the heavy focus on building Indian language models or embedding cultural values â€” calling it a distraction.He puts it simply: "The real issue of building foundation models is not about language capability, but about knowledge and action in the real world."This perspective really struck a chord with me. As someone exploring the intersection of AI and impact, I believe the real value lies in building systems that can reason, adapt, and act â€” not just process language, but drive meaningful outcomes.According to Deloitteâ€™s Tech Trends â€“ India Perspective 2025 report, Indian businesses are already moving in this direction, adopting small, multimodal models to deliver faster, targeted solutions. Itâ€™s exciting to see this shift.ðŸ’¡ My take? One AI trend that I believe will shape 2025 is the rise of actionable intelligence through agent-based AI â€” models that can plan, reason, and autonomously act in dynamic environments. Not just chat â€” but solve, adapt, and execute.What do you think?
